work_experience.text: ) (This was the organization formerly known as CHAOS.) I observed and advised a team that oversaw special projects and community events with the goal of strengthening and growing individual sites within the Stack Exchange network. Provided operational support ("servant leadership") and reported progress to the Chief of Staff.

- present) I lead a small team that maintains and streamlines Community Growth team processes, and support Community Managers as a pluralistic-style manager. And I'm still a part-time podcast producer.

Senior Community Growth Specialist (September 2012 - April 2015) That title is just a fancy attempt to describe being a jack of all trades on the Community Growth team. I functioned as a part-time community manager, a part-time hiring coordinator, and a part-time operations manager. And a part-time podcast producer.

Community Development

(2 years 4 months)

Stage managed three summers' worth of Dominography. Facilitated communication between actors, directors, administrators, and creative team members. Coordinated artistic rehearsals, technical rehearsals, and performances, merging all technical and artistic aspects of production while ensuring that the team kept to an intricate schedule.

Student-Organized Seminar Co-Coordinator/Lecturer at Northwestern University Department of Theatre June 2008 - December 2008 (7 months)

Page2

Organized a semester-long seminar on technical theatre with Garen Checkley during our junior year. Structured the curriculum and syllabus, scheduled weekly guest lecturers, and taught lessons. Developed and administered two final exams, one written and one based on practical skills.
